instruction: Create a Blueprint for an actor that continuously rotates at 90 degrees per second on the Yaw axis.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RotatingActor
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: MakeRotator [X=0, Y=0, Z=90]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat
NODE n4: AddActorLocalRotation

EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute

DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.B [Rotator]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.DeltaRotation [Rotator]
actual_dsl:

NODE n2: GetWorldDeltaSeconds
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=90.0]
NODE n4: MakeRotator [Roll=0.0, Pitch=0.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalRotation

EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute

DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Yaw [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaRotation [Rotator](stypy
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RotatingYaw
PARENT: Actor

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean variable IsActive. On BeginPlay, check if IsActive is true. If true, print Active. If false, print Inactive.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BranchExample
PARENT: Actor

VAR IsActive: Bool = true

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Branch
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.True -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.False -> n4.Execute

DATA n1.IsActive -> n2.Condition [Bool]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConditionalPrint
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConditionalPrint
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that toggles an actor's visibility each time the player presses the Interact input action using a FlipFlop node.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVisibility
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=false]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=true]

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVisibility
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=true]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVisibility
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=true]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a Gate node. On BeginPlay, open the gate. On Tick, pass through the gate and print Ticking. On pressing the Close input action, close the gate.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateExample
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_Tick
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Ticking"]
NODE n5: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Close"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Then -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Pressed -> n2.Close
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_Tick
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Ticking"]
NODE n5: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Close"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.DeltaSeconds -> n4.InString []
EXEC n5.Pressed -> n2.Close }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_Tick
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Ticking"]
NODE n5: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Close"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.DeltaSeconds -> n4.InString []
EXEC n5.Pressed -> n2.Close }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick, gets the distance to another actor stored in a variable called TargetActor. If the distance is less than 500, print Close.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DistanceChecker
PARENT: Actor

VAR TargetActor: Actor = None

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetDistanceTo
NODE n3: LessThanFloat
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Close"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute

DATA n1.TargetActor -> n2.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DistanceCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetActor: Actor = None
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=TargetActor]
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Close"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DistanceCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetActor: Actor = None
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=TargetActor]
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Close"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that prints Started on BeginPlay, prints Tick Count each frame using Event Tick, and prints Goodbye before the actor is destroyed using Event EndPlay.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LifecycleEvents
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Started"]
NODE n3: Event_Tick
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Tick Count"]
NODE n5: Event_EndPlay
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Goodbye"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LifecycleExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Started"]
NODE n3: Event_Tick
NODE n4: GetVar
NODE n5: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n6: SetVar
NODE n7: Concatenate [A="Tick Count: "]
NODE n8: PrintString
NODE n9: Event_EndPlay
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Goodbye"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Int]
DATA n6.Value -> n7.B [String]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.InString [String]
EXEC n9.Then -> n10.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LifecycleExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Started"]
NODE n3: Event_Tick
NODE n4: GetVar
NODE n5: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n6: SetVar
NODE n7: Concatenate [A="Tick Count: "]
NODE n8: PrintString
NODE n9: Event_EndPlay
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Goodbye"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Int]
DATA n6.Value -> n7.B [String]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.InString [String]
EXEC n9.Then -> n10.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay prints Ready, waits 2 seconds, prints Set, waits 1 second, then prints Go.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Countdown
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
